grails.plugin.svn
[Groovy] Class SvnClient

java.lang.Object
  SvnClient

class SvnClient

Abstraction layer for doing Subversion work using the SVNKit library. The SVNKit classes make unit testing difficult, so it makes sense to consolidate and isolate their usage in this one class. It also simplifies working with Subversion.

Creates a new client instance that works against the Subversion repository from which the given working copy was created.

repoUrl

private java.lang.Object repoUrl

 
Constructor Detail

SvnClient

SvnClient(java.net.URI repoUrl)
Creates a new client instance that works against the Subversion repository at the given URL. If the URL ends with '/trunk', that bit of the path is stripped out and the rest used as the base repository URL.

SvnClient

SvnClient(java.lang.String repoUrl)
Creates a new client instance that works against the Subversion repository at the given URL. If the URL ends with '/trunk', that bit of the path is stripped out and the rest used as the base repository URL.

SvnClient

SvnClient(java.io.File wc)
Creates a new client instance that works against the Subversion repository from which the given working copy was created.

 
Method Detail

addDirToSvn

java.lang.Object addDirToSvn(java.lang.Object dir)
Makes sure that a given directory and all the sub-directories and files it contains are added to the Subversion repository on the next commit if they aren't already there. This method assumes that the directory resides in a Subversion working copy. Also, this method does not hit the network/internet, since it just uses the information in the working copy.
Parameters:
dir - Adds everything in the given directory to Subversion (except for those files/dirs in the ignore lists).

addFilesToSvn

java.lang.Object addFilesToSvn(java.lang.Object files)
Makes sure that a given set of files are added to the Subversion repository on the next commit if they aren't already there. This method assumes that the files reside in a Subversion working copy. Also, this method does not hit the network/internet, since it just uses the information in the working copy.
Parameters:
files - A collection of files that should be added to the repository on the next commit.

checkOut

java.lang.Object checkOut(java.lang.Object wc, java.lang.Object relUrl)
Checks out a path within the configured Subversion repository to a local working copy.
Parameters:
wc - (File) The location of the working copy.
relUrl - The path to check out, relative to the base repository URL.

commit

java.lang.Object commit(java.lang.Object wc, java.lang.Object msg)
Commits the changes in a working copy to its corresponding Subversion repository.
Parameters:
wc - (File) The working copy directory.
msg - The commit message to use.
Returns:
SVNCommitInfo if the commit was successful

createPath

java.lang.Object createPath(java.lang.Object path, java.lang.Object msg)
Creates a path in the repository if it doesn't exist. Equivalent to a Subversion 'mkdir'. This method creates all the required parent directories automatically.
Parameters:
path - The relative path to create.
msg - The commit message to use.

fetchFile

java.lang.Object fetchFile(java.lang.Object path, java.lang.Object localFile)
Retrieves the most recent revision of a file from the repository.
Parameters:
path - The path of the file to fetch relative to the root of the repository.
localFile - (File) Where to put the file locally.

getAuthManager

java.lang.Object getAuthManager()

getLatestRevision

java.lang.Object getLatestRevision()
Returns the revision of HEAD in the repository.

getRepoUrl

java.lang.Object getRepoUrl()

getUnversionedFiles

java.lang.Object getUnversionedFiles(java.lang.Object wc)
Returns a list of all unversioned files and directories in the given working copy directory.
Parameters:
wc - The base directory of the Subversion working copy of interest.

ignore

void ignore(java.lang.Object wcPath, java.lang.String patterns)
Sets the ignore list for the given working copy path. The ignore patterns are provided as a '\n'-delimited string.
Parameters:
wcPath - The full path to the directory or file to add the ignores to. This should not be relative to the base working copy directory but preferably and absolute path.
patterns - The '\\n'-delimited list of ignore patterns.

importIntoRepo

java.lang.Object importIntoRepo(java.lang.Object file, java.lang.Object targetPath, java.lang.Object msg)
Imports a local file path (either a file or a directory) into the repository under the given path.
Parameters:
file - (File) The file or directory to import.
targetPath - The path in the repository to import into.
msg - The commit message to use for the import.
Returns:
SVNCommitInfo if the commit was successful

isVersioned

java.lang.Object isVersioned(java.lang.Object file)
Returns true if the given file or directory is under source control.

isWorkingCopyForRepository

boolean isWorkingCopyForRepository(java.lang.Object wc, java.lang.Object path)
Determines whether the given directory is a working copy for the given path in this client's repository.

pathExists

boolean pathExists(java.lang.Object path)
Determines whether the given path exists in the configured repository. Returns true if the path does exist.

setCredentials

java.lang.Object setCredentials(java.lang.Object username, java.lang.Object password)

stripTrunkPath

private java.lang.Object stripTrunkPath(java.lang.String path)
Strips any trailing 'trunk' sub-path and '/' from the given path.

tag

java.lang.Object tag(java.lang.Object srcPath, java.lang.Object tagsPath, java.lang.Object tag, java.lang.Object msg)
Creates a tag in a Subversion repository from a given source URL.
Parameters:
srcPath - The path (relative to the configured Subversion repository URL) to tag.
tagsPath - The relative path to where the tags are created.
tag - The name of the tag to create.
msg - The commit message to use when creating the tag.

tokenizeUrl

protected final java.lang.Object tokenizeUrl(java.lang.Object url)
Extracts any username and password from a URL and returns the base URL, username, and password as separate elements.
Parameters:
url - The URL to be parsed.
Returns:
A tuple of base URL, username, and password.

upToDate

java.lang.Object upToDate(java.lang.Object wc)
Determines whether the given working copy is up to date with respect to the remote Subversion repository.

update

java.lang.Object update(java.lang.Object wc)
Updates the given working copy to HEAD from the repository.
